metadata.title: CVE-2023-6857 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
When resolving a symlink, a race may occur where the buffer passed to`readlink` may actually be smaller than necessary. *This bug only affectsFirefox on Unix-based operating systems (Android, Linux, MacOS). Windows isunaffected.* This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 115.6, Thunderbird <115.6, and Firefox < 121.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6857` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.6.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.6.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.6.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.6.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.6.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.6.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.6.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78 package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
